definition: "the Eight Great Eminent Officials" of the CCP, abbr. for 八大元老[Ba1 Da4 Yuan2 lao3]

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: Shou was bestowed by Empress Dowager Cixi when she presented the Empress with the embroidered tapestry, Eight Immortals Celebrating Birthday.
sentences.chinese: 寿被赋予慈溪太后她皇后绣挂毯，八老庆祝生日。

definition: (respectful for) one's grandfather/sb's father/older people/the head of the house (used by servants)/a district magistrate
Qilin Pavilion, located in the Weiyang Palace, a hall decorated with portraits of famous officials
learned person/expert in a certain field/abbr. for 大方之家[da4 fang1 zhi1 jia1]
Xihuating pavilion on west side on Zhongnanhai, home to 周恩來|周恩来
Imperial College of Supreme Learning, established in 124 BC, and the highest educational institute in ancient China until the Sui Dynasty
